page.title: 14LOCAL ECOLOGY
page.content: Pudsey is separated from the nearby urban centres of Leeds and Bradford by green belt.There are a few farms surrounded by woodland and streams which are used recreationally.A local conservation corps is the watchdog of the area,making sure that it is well-kept.The woodland cover is mainly mixed deciduous,largely oak and silver birch.The woods are regularly coppiced to ensure regrowth of the natural tree cover and to try to contain the sycamores etc. which can dominate an area very easily if left to nature. Nearer the town centre a disused railway track has been made into a nature walk by clearing land and planting various trees,shrubs and grasses.Many animals and birds have been attracted by the renewed growth and the area is now very popular with local residents.
